question: Hi I see connect unlimited email accounts so I purchased a plan and then it shows fair usage limits after I purchased with no indication of this beforehand.
answer:
Hi, this is a industry standard practice we follow unfortunately. All other sequencers also promote themselves as unlimited while having a actual fair usage limit. We have a limit of 300 email accounts for personal plan and 1000 email accounts for business plan.

If this doesn't fit your need we can provide you with a refund. We will look to improve the wording as well.

question: Delivery Status Notification (Delay)
answer:
Hi Taylor, we've just discovered that one of a leading Azure infrastructure providers are having major infrastructure issues. Many of these providers' users account went down.

We have immediately halted warmup sending to these accounts.
​
It was a minor increase that won't influence reputation of other users and we've already halted all the warmup to this provider.


​

question:
Hi team, is there any way to personalize directly through plusvibe the first line of the emails?

The one that recipients see next to the subject.
answer:
This part is usually beginning of your email body.

We don’t allow you to change that

question: In what order to the emails get sent out? Does it go straight in order as to how they are ordered in the spreadsheet, one row at a time starting with the first row? Or is it random? Thanks.
answer: Hi Guy, emails will go out in an order displayed in campaign view once imported.

question:
Hello,
I have some Superwave domains I would like to have uploaded
answer: Please send to support@plusvibe.ai

hi Max, just like other platforms, we have a fair usage policy in place at 1000 max accounts for business plan users. You have reached your maximum allowed limit. To connect extra, it will be $50 per month per extra 1000 email accounts.

I understand the confusion, but it's exactly the same policy other tools on the market have.

question: I have been seeing a few other tools having inbox placement testing. Do you plan to have that? Is it worth it?
answer:
Hi Ricardo, it depends on methodology and quality of the seed list, but generally yes, it's worth it and could be a good indicator of infrastructure health.

It's one of the features we're looking to develop, but timeline here could not yet be estimated yet.

question: Hi
answer:
Hi Greg, we’re currently facing an issue with the lead lists database due to some internal logic update that our database provider was not compatible with.

Some lead lists might be affected unfortunately, and it seems that’s the case for your account.

Your main database of leads that are active in your campaigns are not affected and function normally.

We’re working with Azure to get the data back right now.

Sorry for the inconvenience.
